# SCAR Antarctic Digital Database (ADD) Metadata Toolbox - Updating existing collections

Follow this workflow to update an existing collection (for example to change the items it contains).

**Note:** Items to be shown in the collection need to have [already been added](workflow-adding-records.md).

## Overview

This sequence diagram shows how the overall process to update and view an existing collection:

[![](https://mermaid.-QTogVXBkYXRlIGNvbGxlY3Rpb25cblx0QS0-)](https://mermaid-js.github.io/mermaid-live-editor/#-QTogVXBkYXRlIGNvbGxlY3Rpb25cblx0QS0-)

1. a JSON file defining the collection, and the items it contains, is exported from the metadata editor
2. the JSON file is updated as needed
3. the JSON file is re-imported into the metadata editor
3. collections are built as static HTML pages
4. static HTML pages are published to the static site
5. visitors can access the updated collection page through the static site

## Steps

1. run [`collections export`](command-reference.md#collections-export)
2. update collection file as needed
3. run [`collections import --allow-update`](command-reference.md#collections-import)
2. run [`site build-collections`](command-reference.md#site-build-collections)
3. run [`site publish`](command-reference.md#site-publish)
